IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO RESTORE, MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE AROOSTOOK MEDICAL CENTER IS TO RESTORE, MAINTAIN, AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF OUR FRIENDS AND NEIGHBORS IN A COMPASSIONATE AND PROFESSIONAL ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Description: PROVISION OF ACUTE & SUBACUTE HOSPITAL CARE RELATED TO OUTPATIENT CLINICS AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES. SERVED 29,921 PATIENT DAYS OF ROUTINE SERVICES AND 83,338 OUTPATIENTS. PROVIDED SERVICES REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY AS WELL AS EDUCATION AND PROMOTION OF HEALTH. PROVIDED UNCOMPENSATED CARE (AT COST) OF $1,360,326.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.IncomeBasedCriteria: TAMC DOES NOT PROVIDE DISCOUNTED CARE TO LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. TAMC PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE/FREE CARE BASED ON THE FPL IF GROSS INCOME IS AT OR BELOW 200% OF THE FPL, IF THE PATIENT IS A RESIDENT OF THE STATE OF MAINE OR A NON MAINE RESIDENT SEEKING EMERGENCY CARE, IF THE SERVICE OR SUPPLIES ARE A MEDICAL NECESSITY AND IF ALL THIRD PARTY PAYOR SOURCES HAVE BEEN EXHAUSTED. HOWEVER, PATIENTS WITH SELF-PAY BALANCES WILL BE OFFERED A DISCOUNT OFF CHARGES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: PATIENT AND TRADE ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE STATED AT THE AMOUNT MANAGEMENT EXPECTS TO COLLECT FROM OUTSTANDING BALANCES. MANAGEMENT PROVIDES FOR PROBABLE UNCOLLECTIBLE AMOUNTS THROUGH A CHARGE TO EARNINGS AND A VALUATION ALLOWANCE BASED ON ITS ASSESSMENT OF THE CORRECT STATUS OF INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS. BALANCES THAT ARE STILL OUTSTANDING AFTER MANAGEMENT HAS USED REASONABLE COLLECTION EFFORTS ARE WRITTEN OFF THROUGH A CHARGE TO THE VALUATION ALLOWANCE AND THE APPLICABLE PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE. THE COSTING METHODOLOGY USED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT REPORTED ON LINE 2 IS COST TO CHARGE RATIO.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: MEDICARE LOSSES ARE INCLUDED AS A COMMUNITY BENEFIT BECAUSE THE LOSSES ARE INCURRED IN PERFORMING AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC SERVICE AND MAINE HOSPITALS EXPERIENCE ONE OF THE LOWEST MEDICARE REIMBURSEMENT RATES IN THE COUNTRY.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: ALL ACCOUNT GUARANTORS WHO EXPRESS AN INABILITY TO PAY INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT SERVICES WILL BE SCREENED FOR ELIGIBILITY FOR CHARITY CARE USING AN APPLICATION AND GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY THE AROOSTOOK MEDICAL CENTER. AN ACCOUNT MAY BE RECONSIDERED FOR CHARITY CARE AT ANY TIME WHEN NEW INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ABOUT A PATIENT'S INABILITY TO PAY.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: THE EMHS COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT EXAMINES THE HEALTH STATUS OF THE RESIDENTS OF AROOSTOOK COUNTY AND PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH DATA AND RECOMMENDATIONS ON A VARIETY OF CRITICAL TARGET AREAS INCLUDING COMMUNITY HEALTH EDUCATION, ACCESS TO PRIMARY CARE, CARE FOR CHRONIC CONDITIONS, GERIATRIC CARE, AND MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE. IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THE STUDY, ORIGINALLY CONDUCTED IN 2001 AND REPEATED IN 2007, EMHS CONTRACTED WITH THE CENTER FOR HEALTH POLICY, PLANNING AND RESEARCH (CHPPR) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW ENGLAND (LED BY RON DEPREZ, PHD, MPH). IN 2010, EMHS PARTNERED WITH TWO OTHER MAINE HEALTH SYSTEMS TO REPEAT THE ASSESSMENT; RESULTS ARE EXPECTED IN EARLY 2011.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OR FREE CARE IS AVAILABLE ONLY FOR MEDICALLY NECESSARY SERVICES. POSTERS ARE DISPLAYED IN PATIENT CARE AREAS, INFORMATION AND FORMS ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE ON THE HOSPITAL WEBSITE, AND PATIENT BILLING REPRESENTATIVES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO TAKE CALLS AND TO ANSWER QUESTIONS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: THE AROOSTOOK MEDICAL CENTER'S (TAMC) PRIMARY SERVICE AREA SERVES OVER 27,000 PEOPLE AND INCLUDES 21 TOWNS AND 1 CITY IN CENTRAL AROOSTOOK COUNTY. THE NORTHERNMOST COUNTY IN MAINE AND THE LARGEST, AROOSTOOK COUNTY (POP. 71,488) SPANS 6,453 SQUARE MILES AND INCLUDES 2 CITIES, 54 TOWNS, 11 PLANTATIONS AND 108 UNORGANIZED TOWNSHIPS. CENSUS 2000 REVEALS THE FOLLOWING AROOSTOOK COUNTY DATA:- THE MEDIAN AGE OF AROOSTOOK COUNTY IS 40.7 YEARS. WITH 20 PERCENT OF THE POPULATION 65 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER, AROOSTOOK COUNTY HAS A HIGHER PERCENTAGE OF OLDER ADULTS THAN THE STATE OF MAINE (14.5%)AND THE UNITED STATES (12.4%).- OVER 97 PERCENT OF AROOSTOOK COUNTY IS WHITE, WHICH IS COMPARABLE WITH MAINE OVERALL. THE NEXT LARGEST RACIAL/ETHNIC GROUP IN AROOSTOOK COUNTY IS NATIVE AMERICAN (1.4%), WHICH IS MORE PROMINENT THAN IN MAINE OVERALL (0.6%).- NEARLY 77% OF INDIVIDUALS 25 YEARS OF AGE AND OVER IN AROOSTOOK COUNTY HAVE AT LEAST A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR EQUIVALENT AND 14.6% HAVE A BACHELOR'S DEGREE OR HIGHER. THIS IS LOWER THAN STATE (HIGH SCHOOL 85.4%, BACHELOR'S DEGREE 22.9%) AND NATIONAL AVERAGES (HIGH SCHOOL 80.4%, BACHELOR'S DEGREE 24.4%).- THE MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOME IN AROOSTOOK COUNTY ($28,837) IS CONSIDERABLY LESS THAN STATE ($37,240) AND NATIONAL ($41,994) FIGURES. - AROOSTOOK COUNTY HAD A NEGATIVE 15% POPULATION CHANGE BETWEEN THE YEARS OF 1990 AND 2000. IN THE SAME PERIOD OF TIME, MAINE NOTED A 3.8% POPULATION INCREASE.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityBuildingActivities: THROUGH PUBLIC HEALTH SCREENINGS, PROFESSIONAL AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION, AND CHARITY CARE, TAMC, AS A MEMBER OF EMHS SYSTEM, WORKS HARD TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN OUR COMMUNITY. THROUGH EXECUTIVE-LEVEL PARTICIPATION ON THE BOARDS OF AROOSTOOK PARTNERSHIP FOR PROGRESS, LEADERS ENCOURAGING AROOSTOOK DEVELOPMENT, AND UNITED WAY OF AROOSTOOK, WE ARE SUPPORTING ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY. WE ALSO PROVIDE MONETARY SPONSORSHIP TO THE NORDIC HERITAGE SPORT CLUB TO HELP WITH COMMUNITY TOURISM AND HEALTHY LIFESTYLE ENHANCEMENT. THROUGH THE FISCAL YEAR 2010, TAMC DELIVERED A TOTAL COMMUNITY BENEFIT OF APPROXIMATELY $65,000 FOR COMMUNITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: TAMC WORKS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH A VARIETY OF HEALTH PROMOTION ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS: LET'S GO AROOSTOOK, AN INITIATIVE THAT PROMOTES HEALTHY LIFESTYLE CHOICES FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND ADULTS; HEALTHY AGING, A MONTHLY HEALTHCARE LECTURE DESIGNED FOR SENIOR CITIZENS; SENIOR CONNECTION, A PROGRAM FOR OLDER ADULTS THAT PROVIDES HEALTH SCREENINGS AND INFORMATION, AND LIVING WELL, A CHRONIC DISEASE MANAGEMENT SERIES. WE ALSO SUPPORT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT THROUGH OUR SURVIVOR CAMP, EXPLORERS PROGRAM, AND BOONE LECTURE. IN FISCAL YEAR 2010, TAMC CONTRIBUTED $287,621 IN CASH AND IN-KIND SERVICES TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PROGRAMS DEVOTED TO THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITIES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.AffiliatedHealthCareSystem: USING THE DATA IN THE EMHS COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT, TAMC COLLABORATES WITH OTHER HOSPITALS IN THE EMHS SYSTEM AND WITH OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS ON SOLUTIONS TO SIGNIFICANT COMMUNITY HEALTHCARE PROBLEMS, SUCH AS FLU PANDEMIC, WORKFORCE SHORTAGE, CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE, CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT, DIABETES, YOUTH OBESITY, SEDENTARY LIFESTYLE AND ACCESS TO PRIMARY CARE PROVIDERS. TAMC TAKES THE LEAD ROLE FOR EMHS IN AROOSTOOK COUNTY ON THESE ISSUES AND EMHS PROVIDES SUPPORT AND ADDITIONAL RESOURCES AS NECESSARY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A LIST OF ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS OR TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS COMPILED EACH FISCAL YEAR. CONFLICT OF INTEREST REQUEST FORMS ARE DELIVERED TO EACH PERSON ON THE LIST. RESPONSES ARE COMPILED AND REVIEWED BY STAFF AND PRESENTED TO MANAGEMENT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED IN ADVANCE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS' AND IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE CFO AT A MONTHLY BOARD OF DIRECTORS' MEETING.
